title: A Comparative Analysis of Cascade Measures for Novelty and Diversity
segmentation: This talk is was meant to be presented by Charlie Clarke, but these are actually his slides, so I'll try and do my best job of presenting.
He had to cancel the trip at the last minute.

Point out what we mean by cascade here, so it's a it's a different thing.

It's basically a model of how users view of results page, which is something that actually that I and my coauthors describe or proposed, that the first Wisdom conference and basically the users start at the top of the page and they go cascade down the page and they disappear as they find things that they like, and so that's what I mean by cascade here.
So it's an explanation for why.
Users are less likely to click lower down the page 'cause they already found something up higher.
Also, Charlie and Annezin have a paper at www.that gets does further analysis on the questions in this paper.
